product_name: Charlotte TilburyCharlotte's Magic Eye Cream with Retinol
summary: SummaryCharlotte's Magic Eye Cream with Retinol is an eye cream with ingredients like retinol to protect against signs of aging, reducing the appearance of wrinkles and brightening the look of dark circles.
details: DetailsBenefitsVitamin CRetinolGood for: Anti-AgingGood for: Dark CirclesRefill AvailableSkin Type: Normal, Dry, Combination, and OilySkincare Concerns: Fine Lines and Wrinkles and Dark CirclesKey IngredientsTime-Released Retinol: Visibly smooths, contours, and boosts radiance.Botanical Eye-Contour Complex: Reduces the appearance of dark circles and puffiness.Winter Daphne Stem Cells Extract: Visibly tightens and firms.FeaturesVisibly re-energize your delicate under-eye area with this magical cream.Powered by time-released retinol molecules, the formula works to visibly refine and resurface your skin for more youthful- and radiant-looking eyes.Its rich texture glides on to hydrate, soothe, and reduce the look of puffiness for a rapid, visible refresh.Item 2619438How To UseUsing your ring finger, apply the cream gently to your orbital bone, starting in the inner corners and patting up and out.Gently massage around your entire eye socket for a refreshing, cooling effect.Charlotte's tip: For best results, follow with the Magic Cream Moisturizer with Hyaluronic Acid (sold separately).IngredientsAqua/Water/Eau, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Butylene Glycol, Polysorbate 60, Olus Oil/Vegetable Oil/Huile V√©g√©tale, PEG-7 Glyceryl Cocoate, Glycerin, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea) Butter, PEG-8, Ethylhexyl Stearate, Dicaprylyl Ether, Sorbitan Stearate, Hydroxyethyl Acrylate/Sodium Acryloyldimethyl Taurate Copolymer, Olive Oil PEG-7 Esters, Phenoxyethanol, Saccharide Isomerate, C12-16 Alcohols, Cera Alba/Beeswax/Cire D'abeille, Glyceryl Stearate, Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Squalane, Ethylhexylglycerin, Chlorphenesin, Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Hydrogenated Lecithin, Hydrolyzed Rice Protein, Palmitic Acid, Xanthan Gum, Chondrus Crispus Extract, Disodium EDTA, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Polysorbate 20, Sorbitan Isostearate, Sodium Hydroxide, Glycine Soja (Soybean) Protein, Superoxide Dismutase, Citric Acid, Hydroxypropyl Cyclodextrin, Tocopherol, Sodium Citrate, Iron Oxides (CI 77492), Sodium Benzoate, Sodium PCA, Iron Oxides (CI 77491), Ascorbyl Palmitate, Daphne Odora Callus Extract, Sodium Dextran Sulfate, Nicotiana Sylvestris Leaf Cell Culture, Aluminum Hydroxide, Retinol, Plumeria Rubra Flower Extract, Borago Officinalis Seed Oil, Tocopheryl Acetate, Ascorbic Acid, Lecithin, Potassium Sorbate, Retinyl Palmitate, Ascorbyl Tetraisopalmitate.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Using your ring finger, apply the cream gently to your orbital bone, starting in the inner corners and patting up and out.Gently massage around your entire eye socket for a refreshing, cooling effect.Charlotte's tip: For best results, follow with the Magic Cream Moisturizer with Hyaluronic Acid (sold separately).

reviews.headline: Luxurious
reviews.comments: This cream feels so lux and very moisturizing. Looks great under makeup as long as you give it a little time to dry. Would highly recommend to my dry skin girlies.

reviews.headline: Best way to look more awake
reviews.comments:
This eye cream was created to help models in a runway show at the last minute who had less rthan lovely under eye area. 
I use rhis as i leave the house if my under eye area looks a little dry and wrinkly. This snaps the youth right back!  Will buy again. A little goes a really long way! Lasts a long time

reviews.headline: Beautiful Eye Cream
reviews.comments: I love this eye cream. I have been trying many different brands in Ulta to try to find my perfect go-to eye cream and this is the one. It's so hydrating and smooth when I apply it. My skin feels nourished after I put it on and I will gladly repurchase.

reviews.headline: Irritating
reviews.comments: At first application, you could see a difference in tightness. By the second application the next day I looked like I had an eyelid infection (I only put under my eye). I thought maybe allergies got me even though its the end of the season here. It burns so badly and dried my eyes out. I'm on day 5 and its gotten much worse; creasing, peeling, burning and wrinkles that i've never had. I didnt even think I had sensitive skin - but this is insane! I'm done, I need to go heal my skin now

reviews.headline: Love this
reviews.comments: Best eye cream i've tried and i've tried many. Reitnol may irritate some.

reviews.headline: Keep coming back
reviews.comments: It's pricey, but i keep coming back. I buy trial size of other products but I'm never happy with the results. I'm back, darling

reviews.headline: Dried my eyes out
reviews.comments: I tried this in store and was impressed with the tightening effect. However after purchasing it dried my eyes out so badly even after moisturizing skin prep. Made my eyes crease in new ways I've never seen before...I am returning!

reviews.headline: Sets Eyes on Fire‚Ä¶
reviews.comments: I was hoping this eye cream , which was recommended by an Ulta sales assiciate, would replace the uber-expensive one that I have used for years, but unfortunately, this one is a definite "NO". While a little of this cream goes a long way, if even the smallest amount gets into your eyes, it will cause such discomfort, that you will end up wiping it all away with the tears your eyes produce from the burning. We can all agree that skincare products with retinol are great for slowing down the clock, but should they really be used close to our eyes? Based on my painful (and teary) experience, I think it's probably a bad idea.

reviews.headline: Just tried a sample and ran to buy
reviews.comments: I just tried this in-store and went home to do my makeup to see how it weathered. I tapped onto my under eyes. They look visibly less puffy & creases less visible- my biggest insecurity. Paired beautifully under my tarte colored clay corrector!

reviews.headline: Not sure what others got, but this stuff works
reviews.comments: I got this as a sample as well & am not sure what people are talking about with it pilling. This stuff is soft, fluffy, thick and fulfilling-like on the skin under my eyes. You're only suppose to dab it and tap tap tap - not rub it in like a lotion. If you do that with most products meant for sensitive areas like under the eyes, it will most definitely break down. But, i woke up and under my eyes were so bright, so soft & fine lines were GONE. When I wash my face, i use the Tula face wash, the Thayer's face wipes for toner & then this eye cream, serum and then moisturizer. Face hasn't looked better! So, as for ME, this product is amazing. Even my husband complimented me on how much of a difference it made. So, sample try it for yourself first or just buy it. As for the texture, it's thick and does it's job as far as moisturizing. Buy it!

reviews.headline: It pills
reviews.comments: Disliked this product very much based on the samples. It pills, the texture is weird, I had to wipe it off because it never absorbed

reviews.headline: Wake up to the softest, most hydrated skin.
reviews.comments: A little goes an extremely long way. Received this as part of a 3 piece deluxe sample and absolutely love this particular  cream. I've used it for 5 days straight and already my delicate under eye area seems to have less noticeable fine lines and sppear more vibrant. I already purchased the full size and impatiently waiting for it to arrive.

reviews.headline: Not Worth the Price
reviews.comments: This eye cream is not worth the money. It has a weird texture and does not absorb into the skin, leaves a thin slimy layer under eyes. There are a lot of better options out there for the same or even less money.

reviews.headline: Just not that great
reviews.comments: I really tried to like this, because I like all the rest of CT's skincare. I had samples 3 times. The texture is more slimy than creamy and worse, it pills up on my skin. Pass on this one.

reviews.headline: Love, Love, Love
reviews.comments: Received a deluxe sample, but had low expections.  More balm than cream, approximately 1/2 a small pea size of product covered the extended orbital area. To my delight the morning after, my eyes were plumper, smoother, and brighter. Yes, I purchased a full size product.

reviews.headline: JUST DONT, FOR THE PRICE, NOPE
reviews.comments: I dont understand where all the rave reviews are coming from. I bought literally, the whole line, make up and skin care. It's a lie. For the price of these items, you expect so much more. My skin, not plump, if anything drier. Look at the ingredients. Its harsh.

faceoff_positive.comments: I got this as a sample as well & am not sure what people are talking about with it pilling. This stuff is soft, fluffy, thick and fulfilling-like on the skin under my eyes. You're only suppose to dab it and tap tap tap - not rub it in like a lotion. If you do that with most products meant for sensitive areas like under the eyes, it will most definitely break down. But, i woke up and under my eyes were so bright, so soft & fine lines were GONE. When I wash my face, i use the Tula face wash, the Thayer's face wipes for toner & then this eye cream, serum and then moisturizer. Face hasn't looked better! So, as for ME, this product is amazing. Even my husband complimented me on how much of a difference it made. So, sample try it for yourself first or just buy it. As for the texture, it's thick and does it's job as far as moisturizing. Buy it!
faceoff_positive.headline: Not sure what others got, but this stuff works

faceoff_negative.comments: I was hoping this eye cream , which was recommended by an Ulta sales assiciate, would replace the uber-expensive one that I have used for years, but unfortunately, this one is a definite "NO". While a little of this cream goes a long way, if even the smallest amount gets into your eyes, it will cause such discomfort, that you will end up wiping it all away with the tears your eyes produce from the burning. We can all agree that skincare products with retinol are great for slowing down the clock, but should they really be used close to our eyes? Based on my painful (and teary) experience, I think it's probably a bad idea.

rollup.name: Charlotte's Magic Eye Cream with Retinol
